sen.j: 源 重貞（みなもと の しげさだ、生年不詳 - 治承4年（1180年））は、平安時代末期の武将。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Shigesada (male, unknown to 1180) was a warrior at the end of Heian Period.

sen.j: 鳥羽院四天王の一人とされる源重実の三男。
sen.e: Shigesada was the third son of MINAMOTO no Shigezane who was said to be one of the big four in Tobain.
Shigesada was the third son of MINAMOTO no Shigezane who was said to be one of the big four in Tobain.
Shigesada was the third son of MINAMOTO no Shigezane who was said to be one of the four most loyal retainers of Tobain (the Retired Emperor Toba).
sen.cmt: 「鳥羽院四天王」の意味が明確になるよう訳文を修正しました。

sen.j: 兄に源重遠、源重成がある。
sen.e: Shigesada's elder brothers included MINAMOTO no Shigeto and MINAMOTO no Shigenari.

sen.cmt: 統一事項より、elder brothers→older brothersとしました。

sen.j: 山田先生（やまだせんじょう）と称した。
sen.e: He called himself Yamada-senjo.
He called himself Yamada-senjo.
He called himself Yamada-senjo.

sen.j: 子に重経、山田重満、重国、重継、仲重らがある。
sen.e: Shigesada's children included Shigetsune, Yamada-shigemitsu, Shigekuni, Shigetsugu, and Nakashige.
Shigesada's children included Shigetsune, Yamada-shigemitsu, Shigekuni, Shigetsugu, and Nakashige.
Shigesada's children included Shigetsune, Shigemitsu YAMADA, Shigekuni, Shigetsugu, and Nakashige.

sen.j: 保元元年（1156年）の保元の乱においては、兄の重成と共に後白河天皇方に属して勝利した。
sen.e: In Hogen Rebellion in 1156, Shigesada together with his elder brother, Shigenari, joined the side of the Emperor Goshirakawa and they won.

sen.cmt: 統一事項より、Hogen Rebellion→Hogen War、elder brother→older brotherに修正

sen.j: この際、自らが放った矢が敵方の左大臣藤原頼長の首筋に命中したという（その傷が元で頼長は落命）。
sen.e: During this battle, it was said that an arrow which was shot by Shigesada hit exactly the back of the neck of FUJIWARA no Yorinaga who was sadaijin (minister of the left) on the enemy side (Yorinaga died because of this injury).

sen.j: その後、源為朝を近江国坂田付近で捕縛。
sen.e: After this, Shigesada captured MINAMOTO no Tametomo at a place around Sakata in Omi Province.

sen.j: その功績によって右衛門少尉または、筑後国守に任ぜられた。
sen.e: Because of this performance, Shigesada was appointed as uemon-shoi or the governor of Chikugo Province.

sen.j: 嘉応元年（1169年）の延暦寺強訴入京（嘉応の強訴）に際しては、郎党を率いて内裏の修明門を死守した。
sen.e: In the entrance into Kyoto for Enryaku-ji temple forcible appeal (forcible appeal in Kao Age) in 1169, Shigesada made the best effort with his relatives to protect Shumei-mon gate of the Imperial Palace precinct.

sen.j: 治承4年（1180年）の以仁王の乱に際して、源頼政に従い反平家の兵を挙げたが敗北。
sen.e: In Onin Rebellion (a coup) in 1180, though Shigesada followed MINAMONO no Yorimasa and took up arms, Shigesada's army lost.

sen.j: 領地のある美濃国を目指す途上で死去した。
sen.e: Shigesada died while he was fleeing to Mino Province where he had his own territory.
